document_title: Diphtheria: unpredictable complications and effective prevention
subsection_name: benh-bach-hau.json_7_Diagnosis and testing methods for diphtheria
subsection_content:
When there are any symptoms of diphtheria, the patient needs to immediately go to a medical facility to get an accurate diagnosis of the condition.
Usually for diagnosis, doctors use microscopy. Doctors will make a Gram-stained specimen under a microscope, bacilli stain Gram (+), with two large heads, or Albert stain, bacilli stain blue.
In addition, doctors can also diagnose the disease based on the method of isolating bacteria in a specific environment. But the disadvantage of this method is that results are slow.
